Based on your preferences for a monarch movie, I would recommend "The Scarlet Letter" by Nathaniel Hawthorne. This classic novel tells the story of Hester Prynne, who after committing adultery with her husband Ralph Prynne, is forced to wear a scarlet "A" on her dress as a symbol of her guilt and dishonorable status in society.
Despite its dark and controversial themes, "The Scarlet Letter" has become one of the most widely read and studied novels in American literature. The novel's exploration of themes such as guilt, shame, redemption, sin, and morality have been widely praised for their depth, complexity, and relevance to many different people and cultures around the world.
